title: 114_hr5377
content: SECTION 1. CONGRESSIONAL REVIEW OF AGENCY RULEMAKING. The term 'rule' in section 804 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to exclude certain types of rules, such as those of particular applicability and those related to agency management or personnel. The term 'major rule' in section 804 of title 5, United States Code, refers to any rule that has a significant impact on the economy, with an annual effect of $100,000,000 or more, or a major increase in costs or prices. The term 'major rule' in section 804 of title 5, United States Code, refers to any rule that has a significant impact on the economy, with an annual effect of $100,000,000 or more, a major increase in costs or prices, adverse effects on competition, employment, investment, productivity, innovation, or on the ability of United States-based enterprises to compete with foreign-based enterprises in domestic and export markets, and includes significant guidance documents. The term 'significant guidance document' refers to a guidance document issued by a Federal agency that may lead to an annual effect of $100,000,000 or more, or adversely affect the economy, productivity, competition, or employment. The term 'significant guidance document' refers to a guidance document issued by a Federal agency that may have a significant impact on the economy, productivity, competition, employment, the environment, public health or safety, State, local, or tribal governments or communities, interfere with actions of other Federal agencies, alter budgetary impacts, or raise novel legal or policy issues. The term 'significant guidance document' refers to a guidance document issued by a Federal agency that may have a significant impact on various aspects, excluding certain regulations specified by the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs.
